newsitem.title: UK: BAe shares up on H1 profit jump.
newsitem.headline: BAe shares up on H1 profit jump.

text.p: Shares in British Aerospace Plc jumped in early trade on Thursday as the market hailed what dealers and analysts called a slightly better-than-expected 75 percent jump in first-half pretax profits.
BAe shares, among the six most-heavily traded stocks in pre-market trade, were up 11p at 1,023-1/2p at 0709 GMT while the overall market was indicated barely changed.
"The figures did come in above forecasts. There was an upbeat statement and better cash position than expected," Paul Pickford, analyst at Panmure Gordon in London, said.
The company said pretax profit rose to 199 million stg in the first six months from 114 million a year earlier and raised its dividend to 6.25p from five pence.
Net cash rose to 511 million stg at the end of June from 63 million a year ago.
"It really looks a good performance and the figures are a shade above expectations," one marketmaker said.
